mods.abstract: Page 65 of the album includes five photographs.; Photograph 1 [190] shows a large pig exhibited by a boy in a suit and hat kneeling beside his pig. Probable Boy's Pig Club member. Buildings and silos shown in the background [probably Louisiana State Fair].; Photograph 2 [21] shows several spotted razorback piglets in a wooden pen.; Photograph 3 [191] shows three large pigs in a farm stockyard.; Photograph 4 [192] shows a pig in profile facing right with a wooden fence in the background.; Photograph 5 [193] shows a boy in suit and flat cap standing behind a pig. Probable Boy's Pig Club member. Buildings and silo shown in the background [probably Louisiana State Fair].
mods.note: Compare Photograph 2 to the following publication. Dalrymple, W.H. (1915, June) Breed of Hogs. Extension Circular, No. 3, p. 17. Photograph is captioned, "The Razor-Back."; Photograph 5 is the same photograph found on Page 65, image 193.; Compare all photographs to the following publication. Balis, W.H. (1914, March) Pig Clubs in Louisiana. University Bulletin, Vol. 5, N.S. (No. 3), pp. 1-15. Retrieved August 4, 2014, from https://archive.org/stream/pigclubsinlouisi00loui#page/1/mode/2up

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
